meanings.definition: To let saliva or liquid run from the mouth
meanings.sent1: The baby would slobber when teething.
meanings.sent2: Please don't slobber on the table.
meanings.sent3: The dog would slobber all over the floor, making a mess.
meanings.sent4: Her speech was so emotional that it made her slobber with tears.
meanings.sent5: The leaky faucet continued to slobber water all night.

meanings.definition: Saliva or liquid that runs from the mouth
meanings.sent1: The dog's slobber left wet marks on the couch.
meanings.sent2: She wiped the slobber off her chin with a tissue.
meanings.sent3: The chef accidentally added a drop of slobber to the soup.
meanings.sent4: The slobber on the window indicated the dog was waiting outside.
meanings.sent5: The baby giggled as the puppy's slobber dripped onto its hand.
